aboutme: Hello! My name is Camille Gandotra and I am
a third year undergraduate student studying Computer Engineering
I am interested in Parallel Computing and Software Development.
Currently I am doing research categorizing weak memory patterns from different
I will be joining Microsoft as a Software Developer Intern for the Summer.

relevant courses: Data Structures and Algorithms, Computer Architecture,
Artificial Intelligence, Database Systems, Parallel Programming, Computer Networks,
Computer Systems Design, Embedded Systems Design, Computer Systems and C Programming/Assembly,
Logic Design, Programming Abstractions: Python, Circuits and Systems

description: Assisted deployment of a Slackbot for Timely; an app
augmented with artificial intelligence for improved
scheduling; utilizing Python, Google Cloud Functions, and Slackbot APIs.
Directed 4+ projects, improving user experience and bot's functionality
for scheduling meetings and facilitating decision-making processes.
Increased efficiency exponentially by fully automated
retrieving and updating Logical Partition data for a
mainframe with a Jenkins Pipeline that sets up a Docker
environment to run Robot Framework and Python scripts that
contact the Hardware Management Console with REST API calls.
Integrated Robot Framework Keywords within 10+ testing
pipelines that automate filtering and capturing all relevant
logs/files if requested and uploading the organized data on
Jenkins as Artifacts.
Implemented 3+ responsive UI-Containers for Annota; an
AI-enhanced platform designed for peer learning of qualitative
analysis; utilizing JavaScript/TypeScript and Angular.
Developed the back-end functionality for containers using a cloud
firestore database by using NgRx and RxJS to ensure secure data
management and translated Figma schematics onto user-friendly
web applications using HTML and CSS.
Managed social media accounts to market events/workshops to
increase society engagement and kept website up to date with
current events and announcements.
Conducted behavior interviews and lead the creation of 5+
events for society members including resume workshops, study
sessions, and social meetings.

projects.name: Personal Website
description: This website!

projects.name: MoCode
description: Spearheaded the development of a modern interactive platform
for software developers to aid technical interview preparation
using Agile Scrum.
Built a web scraper to compile essential coding problems, subsequently
recommending selections from this pool using a spaced repetition-based
algorithm for optimized learning.
Incorporated Firebase/Firestore for managing user data, authentication,
and visual progress tracking, enabling personalized learning experiences
and immediate feedback on user improvement.

projects.name: Info Bot
description: Created a Bot using Python and Discordâ€™s API for 4+ servers
of 10+ members that fetches JSON data with recent news articles
relevant to an optional user input.
Implemented an interactive Jeopardy game used daily using JSON data
for a randomized prompt that allows users to compete for personal
accuracy and work together to break the overall streak.
Utilized Replit to host the Bot and its built-in databases to
store Jeopardy statistics and relevant data.
